pp.dorenda.client2

Class MapWidget

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • pp.dorenda.client2.MapWidget
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, pp.dorenda.client2.additional.AdditionalPainterUtility, pp.dorenda.client2.core.MapUpdatedListener

    public class MapWidget
extends javax.swing.JComponent
implements pp.dorenda.client2.core.MapUpdatedListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, pp.dorenda.client2.additional.AdditionalPainterUtility
    The MapWidget is the view that can be integrated into an application. It represents a rectangular area that contains a geographic map.
    Author:
    Joerg.Roth@Wireless-earth.org
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • MapWidget

        public MapWidget()
        This constructor should not explicitly called by the application developer. Instead, place a <org.ohm.mp.widget.MapWidget .../> tag into the layout xml file.

    • Method Detail

      • typeString

        public static java.lang.String typeString(int i)
        Returns a string that describes a specific map type. Note: this description is an artificial string (e.g. 'ALL') and not intended to be used in a 'good' human-readable string.
        Parameters:
        i - map type number
        Returns:
        description

      • configureDiskCache

        public static void configureDiskCache(java.lang.String cacheDir,
                                      int maxTiles)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Installes a disk cache for tiles. A maximum of cached tiles is defined.
        Parameters:
        cacheDir - directory for cache files
        maxTiles - maximum number of cached tiles
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the cache directory does not exist.

      • configure

        public static void configure(java.lang.String mapAccessDefinition)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Configures an Instance of a specific map access module, defined by a creation string. The method understands the following string definitions:
        • webservice;host:port or webservice;host: instantiate an object of pp.dorenda.client2.access.WebserviceAccess
        • webservice;...;cachedir#maxtiles: webservice with directory cache
        • http;root-url: instantiate an object of pp.dorenda.client2.access.HTTPAccess
        • http;...;cachedir#maxtiles: http with directory cache
        • directory;directory: instantiate and object of pp.dorenda.client2.access.FileAccess
        • multizip;directory: instantiate and object of pp.dorenda.client2.access.MultiZipAccess
        Parameters:
        mapAccessDefinition - map access string
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the map access was not successful

      • configure

        public static void configure(pp.dorenda.client2.access.MapAccess mapAccess)
        Pass some configuration to the MapWidget. This method is static as the application developer does no explicit instantiation of this component. Call this method before your activity calls setContentView(...);
        Parameters:
        mapAccess - map access object

      • setScale

        public void setScale(double scale)
        Sets the scale. The scale enlarges (or reduces) the map image. E.g. a scale factor of 2.0, each pixel of the original map is shown as 2x2 pixels on the screen. Important: scale and zoom factor are different concepts: the scale just affects the bitmap size, whereas the zoom controls the set of elements shown on the screen.
        Parameters:
        scale - a scale factor: 1.0d means no scale, >1: pixels are enarged, <1: pixels are dropped

      • addMapDragListener

        public void addMapDragListener(pp.dorenda.client2.event.MapDragListener listener)
        Registers a listener, that will be informed, when a drags on the map. Note that dragging usually scrolls the map. Thus additonally dragging (e.g. to create a selection rectangle must be done by right mouse button or left mouse button with modification key (e.g. shift).
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener

      • setCenterPosition

        public void setCenterPosition(int latitudeE6,
                              int longitudeE6,
                              int zoomIndex,
                              float angle)
        Sets the current map center, zoom and angle and redraws it.
        Parameters:
        latitudeE6 - the new map's center position (latitude)
        longitudeE6 - the new map's center position (longitude)
        zoomIndex - the zoom index to set
        angle - the desired angle in degrees (0..360)

      • setTypeIndex

        public void setTypeIndex(int typeIndex)
        Sets the current type and redraws the map.
        Parameters:
        typeIndex - the type as supported by the tile store

      • getAngleSteps

        public int getAngleSteps()
        How many angle steps does the map view support. If e.g. 4 this means degrees of 0,90,180,270

        the number of angle steps

      • getCurrentViewRectE6

        public int[] getCurrentViewRectE6()
        Get the view's current rectangle.
        Returns:
        array of 4 ints [0]: latitude (north border), [1] longitude (west border) [2]: latitude (south border), [3] longitude (east border)

                       java.awt.Color fillColor,
                       Coordinate coord)
        Paints a point.

        coord - point coordinate

      • paintLine

        public void paintLine(java.awt.Graphics g,
                      java.awt.Color col,
                      Coordinate[] coords,
                      int mode,
                      int thickness)
        Paints a line string that connects the given geo coordinates. We have the folling modes
        • 0: points are not marked
        • 1: line points are marked by cicles but in low density - optimized for viewing
        • 2: all line pointes are marked by cicles
        • 3: line pointes are marked by numbers (with low density)
        • 4: Arrow
        Specified by:
        paintLine in interface pp.dorenda.client2.additional.AdditionalPainterUtility
        Parameters:
        g - graphics to paint on
        col - color
        coords - line points
        mode - line mode
        thickness - thickness

      • paintPolygon

        public void paintPolygon(java.awt.Graphics g,
                         java.awt.Color col,
                         Coordinate[] coords)
        Fills a polygon. The polygon is closed automatically, i.e. the last coordinate has not to be equals to the first.
        Specified by:
        paintPolygon in interface pp.dorenda.client2.additional.AdditionalPainterUtility
        Parameters:
        g - graphics to paint on
        col - color
        coords - polygon points

      • paintJTSGeometry

        public void paintJTSGeometry(java.awt.Graphics g,
                             java.awt.Color col,
                             Geometry geom,
                             int linemode,
                             int thickness)
        Paints any JTS geometry, i.e.
        • Multipolygones are painted by paintMultipolygon
        • Lines are painted by paintLine with the given line mode
        • Points are painted by paintPoint
        Specified by:
        paintJTSGeometry in interface pp.dorenda.client2.additional.AdditionalPainterUtility
        Parameters:
        g - graphics to paint on
        col - color
        geom - geometry
        linemode - mode for lines, see AdditionalPainterUtility.paintLine(Graphics, Color,Coordinate[],int,int)
        thickness - line thickness

      • paintPositionMarker

        public void paintPositionMarker(java.awt.Graphics g,
                                java.awt.Color col,
                                Coordinate coord,
                                int radius,
                                java.lang.String text,
                                double[] bar,
                                int[] barcol)
        Paints a circular position marker on the given geo coordinate. If text!=null, it will be printed at the position. If bar!=null, a colored bar indicates the values (i.e. 0.5, 0.8 will paint two bars bar with 50%, 80%)
        Specified by:
        paintPositionMarker in interface pp.dorenda.client2.additional.AdditionalPainterUtility
        Parameters:
        g - graphics to paint on
        col - color
        coord - coordinate
        radius - radius
        text - text
        bar - bar values
        bar - barcol colors
        barcol - bar colors

      • setLightenedMap

        public void setLightenedMap(boolean lightened)
        Define, whether the map (not the overlays) should be painted lightened or normal. The lightened mode make the overlay paintings more clearer for, e.g. screenshots.
        Parameters:
        lightened - true for lightened mode
